title: [第十届擂台赛作品] seer007100's Work | Dawn Studio
author: seer007100
txt_content:
本帖最后由 seer007100 于 2016-7-19 18:55 编辑 

Watch Out!
Don't stuck in the sand!

About the Map
I had signed up the competition before my journey to Beijing and Tianjin. But I had just started to making the map 1 week before the deadline of the competition! I think this map must have tonnes of bugs. So I say sorry to you guys on here first.


The Screenshot

 ^ Lobby of the minigame

 ^ The sign for join the game

 ^ Playfield of the minigame

 ^ The sand will drop down from the sky to the playfield

 ^ The mechanism of the minigame

 ^ the ramdomizer of the puzzle

 ^ I also leave the puzzle customizer for you to design you own puzzle!


Download the Game
Baidu: http://pan.baidu.com/s/1eSyRtke (Password: xdiu)


By Jason Kwok

replies.author: pca006132
replies.txt_content:
我想不到为何楼主要用英文。
首先，我不认为打中文会比打英文慢太多，反正我们大部分人打中文还是打的很开心的。
第二，楼主英文水平我真不觉得是那些母语是英文的外籍华侨/外国人，甚至还比不上我认识的一些人。从楼主的文法和用字上已经觉得楼主英文水平高得有限，那么为何要用英语呢？打英文很excited吗？
第三，这里是中文论坛。我觉得这已经足够解释一切了: 用户大部分都是看中文的，即使你是外国人不懂中文要发帖，在这里也得找人去翻译成中文，何况你其实会中文？
说真的，别总是希望搞个大新闻，你还是too young, too simple，看看wiki那群翻译，那比你不知道高到哪里去了！作为一个长者有必要提醒你，地图评分很看印象分的，而且你这样不是叫出众，你这样子装逼还不成功被人吐糟成这样只是一个笑话，评委对你的印象就不用说了。

replies.author: cyqsimon
replies.txt_content:
Jesus christ.

So I came over this post from our group chat and that was my first reaction. Oh lord, those grammar mistakes. Just as an example, it's "don't GET stuck in the sand" instead of what you wrote. In English we don't use adjectives as verbs, my dear fellow native Chinese speaker.

Ok, so here's the deal. Unless you are absolutely confident with your English and has a means of proving it, such as a TOEFL 116/120 or whatnot (which happens to be my score by the way), maybe you should seriously consider the possibility that instead of making you sound smart and intelligible, speaking a language out of appropriate context makes you sound awkward and dumb instead. Not to mention this whole pile of mistakes you have in there.

Well, if you still insist using this unfamiliar language after all this explanation, can you PLEASE proof read your post as it is filled with excessive and/or inappropriate usage of words, apart from the already overwhelming number of grammar mistakes.
